div.p: The role that a provenance participant played
This value set defines its own terms in the system http://hl7.org/fhir/provenance-participant-role

tr.td: A person entering the data into the originating system
The data entry person is collected optionally for internal quality control purposes. This includes the transcriptionist for dictated text
A person, animal, organization or device that who actually and principally carries out the activity
Device should only be assigned as a performer in circumstances where the device is performing independent of human intervention. Need not be the principal responsible actor
A party that originates the resource and therefore has responsibility for the information given in the resource and ownership of this resource
Every resource should have an author
A person who verifies the correctness and appropriateness of activity
This is often used in association with the institution that hosts an activity
A verifier who attests to the accuracy of the resource
A person who reported information that contributed to the resource
e.g., a next of kin who answers questions about the patient's history
An information source from which the portions of the resource are derived
May be an electronic document, application, paper record, etc. *Not* a person
A party, who may or should receive or who has received a copy of the resource or subsequent or derivative information of that resource
An application with a user interface that interacts with a person
A background process that transfers information from one place or form to another

description.value: The role that a provenance participant played
